section.p: You are brought into the presence of the god himself. He wears the war-gear of a mighty overlord, his face hidden in the gloom of a great iron visor.
'You have striven long and hard in my service,' he says. 'Now is the time for your reward.'

A seneschal, bony and lavender of skin, comes forward bearing a magnificent sword of white metal. This is bestowed on you amid much ceremony. The assembled dead give a cheer - though it sounds like the death-groan of a multitude - as you buckle the sword to your belt.
Add the to your list of possessions. You can never lose this sword; it cannot be stolen from you or lost. Even if you die and are resurrected elsewhere, the sword will still be with you.
